description: Borrowed from Medieval Latin punctuare (“to mark with points”), from Latin punctus, perfect passive participle of pungō (“I prick, punch”); see point, and compare punch and punctate.

verbs.description: punctuate (third-person singular simple present punctuates, present participle punctuating, simple past and past participle punctuated)

examples: That occurrence of "its" needs to be punctuated as "it's".

entries.meaning: (transitive) To add or to interrupt at regular intervals.
examples: My father punctuated his tirade with thumps on the desk.
